gGnome 0.1
  • Reference

    Finds quasi-reciprocal pairs of junctions

    qrp.Rd

    Finds (quasi) reciprocal pairs of junctions. Very related to chromoplexy or tic "cycles", but with exactly two junctions.

    qrp(
  gg,
  thresh = 1e+06,
  max.small = 1e+05,
  breakend_pairing = c("strict", "one_to_one", "loose"),
  mark = TRUE,
  mark.col = "purple"
)

    Arguments

    gg

    gGraph

    thresh

    integer - maximal size of bridge. Default: 1e6

    max.small

    integer indicating maximum size of candidate SVs for clustering. Default: 1e5

    breakend_pairing

    "strict": can only be "monogamously" matched to one breakend and if the nearest breakend is of the wrong orientation, it is thrown out; "one_to_one:" breakends can only be coupled to a single "monogamous" match but without considering breakends of the wrong orientation. If breakend B is nearest to C, B will only be matched to C. If A's nearest breakend is B but is further away than C, A will not be matched to B. "loose": the nearest breakend in the correct orientation under the threshold is considered. The same as one_to_one except A will be matched to B, while B will be matched to C. Default: c("strict", "one_to_one", "loose")

    mark

    logical, mark the edges and nodes in color specified by mark.col. Default: True

    mark.col

    character, color to mark nodes/edges involved in any QRP. Default: purple

    Value

    gGraph with $ecluster marking on nodes and edges labeling unique reciprocal events

    Author

    Kevin Hadi

    Contents

    Developed by Xiaotong Yao, Marcin Imielinski.
